    • Method Detail

      • produceOrderReport

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> produceOrderReport(java.time.LocalDate date,
                                                         java.math.BigInteger storeID)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception

        This function receives details if the report does not exist and produces it by receiving the relevant data from the DB in this case all orders data. Then calculates the number of orders of each type and sums the prices of all orders of same kind.

        Parameters:
        date - - the end of the requested quarter date
        storeID - - the storeId of the store we want to check
        Returns:
        The returned value is an arraylist of object that the client parsing into the requested type of data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - -because this function calls to analyzeOrders

      • analyzeOrders

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> analyzeOrders(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> objs)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception

        This function takes the information from the server and processes it into a report with all the data associated with it, and returns the report to the client. In addition, this function calls setPIOsInOrder to attach to each order the products linked to it.

        Parameters:
        objs - - ArrayList of orders of the requested store.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of OrderReport (object that the client controller parsing)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - if there is no data that returns from the server (DB)

      • setPIOsInOrder

        void setPIOsInOrder(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> objs)
             throws java.lang.Exception

        This function links to each order the products within it.

        Parameters:
        objs - - ArrayList of products of the requested order.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - if there is no data that returns from the server (DB)

      • add

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> add(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> arr)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception

        A function that inserts a row into a orderreport table in DB

        Parameters:
        arr-ArrayList - of Object that represents the data that we want to insert as row in DB
        Returns:
        always NULL
        Throws:
        Exception- - insertWithBatch Contacting the DB and can throw EXCEPTION at any time if the query fails
        java.lang.Exception

      • handleGet

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> handleGet(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> obj)

        A function that get objects from the DB and calls parse after parse it pushes the data back as a report

        Parameters:
        obj - - an array list of objects the represent row in orderreport table in DB
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Objects with all the information that related to the asking report

      • getOrderReport

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> getOrderReport(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> arr)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception

        A function that performs a query to check whether the requested report exists in the database. If it does return the above report another produces it (if it is in the correct date range)

        Parameters:
        arr - - the arguments that send from the client which we used to make the query from the DB arr is arraylist because we can send only one argument so all the requested arguments are collected into this arraylist.
        Returns:
        The returned value is an arraylist of object that the client parsing into the requested type of data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - -if somthing went wrong with the ask from the DB
